summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests and logistical planning for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). It details multiple trips planned for 2019-2020 to conduct victim interviews in locations including West Palm Beach, Los Angeles, and Stockholm, Sweden, highlighting the ongoing investigative efforts.

connections.description: Both are part of the SDNY investigative/prosecutorial team traveling together for interviews related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: SDNY team members plan to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation, with specific flight itineraries discussed.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: The team requests permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: The team requests permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: S and another team member request permission to travel to West Palm Beach for an interview related to the Epstein investigation, including reserving a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: The team requests permission to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Travel to Florida for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: S and another team member request permission to travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for two days of meetings and interviews for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The document references the ongoing Epstein investigation under case number 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The SDNY investigative team was actively conducting victim interviews across multiple locations (Florida, California, and internationally in Sweden) from at least March 2019 through February 2020.
Travel requests emphasize the need for refundable international tickets and hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The email chain reveals logistical coordination and approval processes within the U.S. Attorney's Office for investigative travel.
Multiple team members are involved, though most names are redacted or represented by initials (S, M).
